transcripts.text: Iran's supreme leader, I don't like saying that.  All right, but I said it.  Today made a rare appearance in public to call Trump a clown who can't be trusted and praised the missile strikes against U.S.  forces.  Well, the comments came two weeks after President Trump ordered that killing of Qasem Soleimani via airstrike.  And the day since, of course, Democrats in the media have sworn up and down that this was ill-advised and had only united Iran.
But is that really the case?

We recently spoke to Iranian-American activist Erika Kasraei, whose viral video explaining how actual Iranian citizens feel has amassed nearly 5.6 million views.  We started by asking her to respond to this from some in the media.
Soleimani's death seems to have united the people.  We saw something like a million people turn out on the street there.
The crowds are massive and emotional.
There are many tears here.
The funeral, the scenes inside Iran, the sea of people, not just to mourn this man who was beloved by so many, but really they're rallying around a regime.
Erica, what's your message to the American media today?  Nancy Pelosi said, you know, when you kill the number two in any country, like, people are going to get upset.  It's just the number two.

Well, thank you so much for having me.  What I want the American people to know is that the majority of the Iranian people view Qasem Soleimani as a terrorist who has terrorized the entire region, and they don't relate to the narrative that the left has.

Look at those pictures, the size of the crowds.  I mean, to people who might not know a lot about the region, that looks like a revered philanthropist, humanitarian, Oprah-like figure has been killed.  And Chris Matthews compared the death of Soleimani to how people felt when Princess Diana and Elvis died.

Well, what most people don't know is that the regime intimidates people into going to these types of rallies.  How so?  Well, the government of Iran has about four million employees, so obviously they give the employees the day off.  A lot of the people that you see there are from rural villages.  They bus people in.  They give them incentives like food.  And as you know, right now, the economy in Iran is plummeting.  People are hungry.  They're jobless.  The value of the dollar has decreased tremendously.  So the people that you see at the rally not only are paid to be there, but they're intimidated to come.

When you watch the coverage as it was, whether it was the downing of the passenger jet and you have members of the media, political figures running for president, others speculating that it was Trump and his taking out Soleimani that caused the domino effect that ended up taking down the plane.  In other words, blaming Trump.  Is that fair in your mind?

Well, with all due respect to my friends on the left, I feel like since President Trump has been elected, he can do no right.  They have blamed him for everything.  And frankly, I think it's time for us to have genuine discussions and debates.  And I felt like, for me, the reason I even made that video was because a lot of my friends were calling me like, hey, what do you think about what's going on?  And what's your opinion?  And I just made a little video because I just wanted my friends to know and my network.  you know, the Iranian people are happy.  And it was, I was genuinely just nauseated.  I was like, what?  What?  why do we have sympathy for a terrorist when I'm getting videos and pictures from people inside Iran that are happy?

We have some some pictures, by the way.  The first photo I want to put up is the photos of a few girls.  It looks like they're mourning the death of Soleimani.  So those are the kinds of images we see.  What's the real story behind that?

So in Iran, like, you know, us, I remember a time when I came to this country, we would say the Pledge of Allegiance when we go to school, right?  Well, in Iran, children, their Pledge of Allegiance is saying death to America and death to Israel.  So in Iran, children are forced to chant death to America and death to Israel.  So that kind of indoctrination starts very young.  And so what you see in this picture is children who are being forced to mourn.  And so this is the regime's propaganda that they circulate in social media.  in social media.
And then women who seem to be, as you said earlier, seem to be really happy that Soleimani was taken out.  We have a picture of that as well.

Yeah, this is two women who are celebrating.  They put this video out on social media.  You know, these were the videos that unfortunately our friends on the left haven't HAD ACCESS TO AND REFUSED TO SHOW.
THEY'RE AVAILABLE.  YOU CAN FIND THEM IF YOU WANT TO FIND THEM.  WE REALLY APPRECIATE YOU JOINING US.  THANK YOU SO MUCH.

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR STOPPING BY.  I JUST WANT TO GIVE A QUICK SHOUT OUT TO PRESIDENT TRUMP.  THERE'S A PICTURE CIRCULATING RIGHT NOW ON SOCIAL MEDIA.  that there's a wall in Iran.  As soon as the news broke, it's hashtag, which in English, it translates to, Trump, you're the man.  So thank you, President Trump, for having the moral courage to make such a hard decision.
All right, Erica, thanks for bringing that to our attention.  Thank you.
